Pacific Noir Horology Office

The Clock Has Filed a Correction and We Are Building the Glass Sea.

Our principal witness is a brass clock that lies with devotion. Every false hour opens a warm current through the snow. We are raising capital to preserve its nightly testimony inside the globe, where our investigators continue their shifts after death and still answer every bell.

Current Campaign

Operation Glass Sea

Target reserve: $480,000 for archive refrigeration, reef-safe neon relays, and legal custody of the lying mechanism. Contributions are held in the Tideward Escrow Bank, disbursed only at false dawn.

Backers receive sealed dispatches, listening privileges, and a place in the watch ledger kept beneath the globe.

Live Under Oath

Internal Memo

Night Staff

The bureau floor is staffed by sixteen retained spirits: former stenographers, marine adjusters, and one ballroom pianist. They process claims between 00:13 and 04:40 and never miss a filing deadline.

If you hear tapping from the west wall, leave tea in the copper tray. That is Payroll.

Affidavit

Statement From the Clock

It swears the missing minutes were never stolen. They were sheltered. It further states that truth arrives last, damp with salt, and should be dried flat before use.
